patterns: What information can you give me about the University of Hertfordshire?
Can you tell me about the University of Hertfordshire?
What is the University of Hertfordshire?
Could you provide me with details about the University of Hertfordshire?
I would like to know about the University of Hertfordshire, can you help me?
What can you tell me about the University of Hertfordshire?
UH
Tell me something about University of Hertfordshire?
Tell me something about UH?
responses: The University of Hertfordshire is a public research university located in Hatfield, Hertfordshire, United Kingdom. It was founded in 1952 as Hatfield Technical College and gained university status in 1992. The university has over 25,000 students and offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate degree programs across various disciplines, including science, engineering, business, humanities, and the arts. The university is known for its strong industry links and has partnerships with a number of leading companies, including Microsoft, Samsung, and the BBC. It has also been awarded the Times Higher Education award for 'Entrepreneurial University of the Year' in 2010 and the 'Outstanding Support for Students' award in 2018. The university has a vibrant and diverse campus community and provides a wide range of student support services, including accommodation, careers advice, and academic support.

I'm looking to update my personal particulars.
My intention is to make updates to my personal information.
Personal Information
responses: Thank you for contacting us regarding the update of your personal information. We are happy to assist you with this process. Kindly access your Student Record http://www.studentrecord.herts.ac.uk/ by logging in with your credentials. Once you have logged in, locate your underlined name next to your photo and click on it. From there, please verify your registered addresses to ensure their accuracy. Should you wish to modify any of your contact information, kindly click on the edit button located below the specific field. Once you have made the necessary updates, please be sure to click on the UPDATE button to save your changes. We hope this process has been a pleasant one for you, and we remain at your service should you require further assistance.

responses: To obtain a student letter from the University of Hertfordshire, you can follow the steps provided on this page: https://ask.herts.ac.uk/student-letters-cae5998a-cefd-447d-ab93-526064295952. The page provides guidance on how to request different types of letters, including enrollment letters, confirmation of studies letters, and letters for visa purposes. You will also find information on the turnaround times for letter requests and how to collect your letter once it is ready. If you have any further questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact the Student Centre.

responses: Sure! The University of Hertfordshire offers a variety of study abroad options for students who are interested in pursuing their education overseas. To get started, you can visit our Study Abroad page at https://ask.herts.ac.uk/study-abroad, where you will find a wealth of information about the different programs that are available, the eligibility criteria, and the application process. You can also explore the various study abroad opportunities by visiting the Study Abroad Office, located in the Student Centre on the College Lane Campus. The Study Abroad team will be happy to answer any questions you may have and provide guidance on the application process. In addition, if you are looking for specific countries to study in, you can use this link to explore the different options: https://ask.herts.ac.uk/where-can-i-study-abroad. This page provides a list of countries where you can study abroad and also includes information on the types of programs available in each country.

responses: The eligibility criteria for the study abroad program may vary depending on the specific program and the university's policies. However, in general, undergraduate students are typically the main target audience for study abroad programs. That being said, it is still worth checking with your university's study abroad office to see if there are any programs available for graduate or postgraduate students. You can find more information about the eligibility criteria and requirements for the University of Hertfordshire's study abroad program on the Study Abroad page at https://ask.herts.ac.uk/study-abroad.

responses: One great resource for finding jobs as a student is Handshake. Handshake is an online platform that connects students and recent graduates with job and internship opportunities. You can create a profile and upload your resume, and then browse through thousands of job postings and apply directly through the platform. Handshake also offers career fairs and events, as well as resources and tips for job searching and career development. To get started, visit https://herts.joinhandshake.co.uk/login and log in with your university credentials. Good luck with your job search!

How do I go about applying for the EU Settlement Scheme, can you help me with that?
I need some guidance on the EU Settlement Scheme, can you direct me to some resources?
responses: Certainly! The EU Settlement Scheme (EUSS) is a program designed to protect the rights of EU, EEA, and Swiss citizens living in the UK after Brexit. If you are an EU, EEA, or Swiss national, you may need to apply for the EU Settlement Scheme to continue living in the UK after June 30, 2021. To learn more about the EU Settlement Scheme and how to apply, please visit the University of Hertfordshire's dedicated webpage on the topic at https://ask.herts.ac.uk/eu-settlement-scheme-euss. Here, you will find comprehensive information about the scheme, including eligibility requirements, application processes, and support available to you as a student at the University of Hertfordshire.

I am interested in pursuing a research degree, can you provide more information on the application process?
responses: At Hertfordshire, we offer a range of research degrees, including Doctor of Philosophy (PhD), Master of Philosophy (MPhil), and Professional Doctorate programs. To learn more about the research degrees available, please visit our research page at http://www.herts.ac.uk/research. If you're interested in applying for a research degree, please send your initial enquiry to doctoralcollegeadmissions@herts.ac.uk. Our university has a diverse range of research groups and centers working on cutting-edge research in various fields, including science, engineering, social sciences, humanities, and the arts. To explore the current research being conducted at Hertfordshire, you can browse our research themes and centers at http://www.herts.ac.uk/research/centres-and-groups. We're committed to producing world-class research that makes a real difference in the world, and we encourage students to get involved in research projects and pursue their own research interests. If you have any questions or would like more information, please don't hesitate to contact us.

tuition fee dates
responses: You can find the tuition fee liability dates for the 2021-22 academic year at the following link: https://ask.herts.ac.uk/2021-22-semester-a-and-b-tuition-fee-liabilty-dates. It's important to note that the tuition fee liability dates determine the deadline for paying your tuition fees or arranging for a payment plan. If you miss the deadline, you may incur late payment fees or even risk being withdrawn from your course. Be sure to check the tuition fee liability dates for your specific program and plan accordingly to avoid any issues. If you have any further questions or concerns, you can contact the university's student finance team for assistance.

patterns: How I can get the student oyster 18+?
What is the process to obtain an 18+ student Oyster card?

How do I apply for an 18+ student Oyster card?
Is there a way for me to get an 18+ student Oyster card?

Can you guide me on how to get a student Oyster card for people aged 18 and over?
Where can I find information on applying for a student Oyster card as an 18+ student?
Student Oyster Card
responses: To get a Student Oyster 18+ card, you must first be enrolled in a full-time course at a university or college that's registered with Transport for London. Once you've enrolled, you can apply for the card online through the TfL website. You'll need to provide your university or college enrolment details, your course start and end dates, and a digital photo of yourself. You'll also need to pay a fee for the card. It's important to note that the Student Oyster 18+ card is only available to full-time students who are 18 or over and studying on courses lasting at least 14 weeks. You'll also need to be living in a London borough during term time to be eligible. For more information and to apply for the Student Oyster 18+ card, please visit the TfL website at https://tfl.gov.uk/fares/free-and-discounted-travel/18-student-oyster-card.

responses: To access your My Learning dashboard, simply click on the 'My Learning' chart icon located on your StudyNet homepage at https://www.studynet.herts.ac.uk/. This will take you directly to your personalised dashboard, which provides a quick and easy overview of your course materials, assessments, and progress. If you need more information about using the My Learning dashboard, you can visit the official Hertfordshire University website and browse the frequently asked questions at https://ask.herts.ac.uk/my-learning-dashboard. Additionally, if you encounter any technical issues or have further questions, you can always contact the IT Services Helpdesk for assistance.
